text: We've walked by this constantly and finally decided to stop in.  First off, the place is tiny.  It's difficult to maneuver around the restaurant and some of the seating (including where we sat) was tucked away in a corner.   The food wasn't good, nor was it bad.. it just was food.  We got the Breakfast sandwich, which has eggs, potatoes bell peppers, lettuce, harissa sauce and some potatoes and fruit on the side.  The sides are the first thing I noticed - there seems to a disproportionate amount of fruit and potatoes to the actual sandwich.   I will give points for presentation but to be blunt, it's just that.  It was actually really difficult to eat.  You have to disassemble the sandwich to actually consume it.  Maybe I just need to head back there for something else next time, but wasn't that impressed with the flavor.

I loooooooove the Flower Flat, it's such a hidden gem. I have been three times now - twice for dinner and once for Sunday brunch. I go every time I visit Chicago and it's always delicious. The place is very small and I recommend emailing to reserve a table on weekend evenings. The decor is so cute and very homey, service is always good!

Great food great service great atmosphere. The decoration is a jumble of things that just work well together, will be coming back- hopefully soon! My boyfriend and I had the BLT and Sugar and Spice Waffle, very filling because of the larger than normal portions.

Absolutely love The Flower Flat. We've been here for numerous occasions, including brunch and dinner. It's incredibly quaint and delightful. Betsy is wonderful and each time she creates a delicious menu. When friends or family come in town, we always make a point to go here during their visit. We cannot recommend it enough. If you're looking for an intimate setting for you and your loved ones, this is the place. Take your time, enjoy the company of those around you, and bring a bottle of wine too!
What an amazing find tucked away in this old garden level apartment. Really friendly staff and delicious coffee- definitely will be coming back  Definitely a unique and fun spot

I love stumbling across little hidden gems like this in big cities.  This cute little French-bistro inspired cafe is very easy to miss, and is most likely a guarded secret for those living nearby!   The decor is very French provincial with kitschy little paintings of Chicago and pets adorning the walls.  You'll forget for a moment you are in Chicago. The service is very timid, and to some may seem slow or unapproachable.  I appreciate quiet service where you are allowed time to relax, take in the atmosphere, and before long you have a glass of water and a menu at your table.  We live lives that always seem hurried, and this place feels like a good spot to slow down, read a book, talk to a friend, or think about future plans. The selections here are limited, with 4 or 5 items on the breakfast menu....but all sound delicious.  From reading the menu, the owner is the cook...so get ready for a home cooked meal.  I had the scrambled eggs, potatoes, toast, and fresh fruit with a cold press of coffee.  Everything feels "made from scratch" or "local", and the coffee was very delicious.  The eggs were light, fluffy, and required no salt or pepper. If you're in the Wrigley area, it's worth a small walk here to enjoy a simple meal, at a decent price.  I'm not sure what else anyone could ask for.

Looking to host an event for a small gathering, The Flower Flat is the place.  I recently hosted a bridal shower for my niece, the party was a success!  The atmosphere is cozy, charming and the food is great. It is obvious the owner, Betsy enjoys sharing this space and entertaining.  She was a big help arranging this affair.  The flowers were beautiful and the Bubbly Bar was enjoyed by all.

Cake here with friends for brunch. Really nice place with good service and all essentials for brunch comfort food. Has a home setting and reasonably priced. Definitely suggest if you are around lakeshore.

No one greeted us for awhile and there was no sign to seat ourselves... so we waited a few mins and then sat down. After awhile of sitting around we decided to leave and of course that's when someone came up with the menu. After that, service improved and it was an enjoyable event.

Betsy did the flowers for my wedding this March and I could not be happier with both the quality of the arrangements and the excellent customer service that she provided. My husband and I love going to the Flower Flat for brunch and went there frequently when we were dating. Would highly recommend!

Outstanding, feels like you just walked downstairs to grandma's kitchen. No fast food here, you order it then she makes it. Just a little place that you wouldn't think twice about, but you should. Staff is amazing, well everything. Let's put for this way, when you walk in here you are transported out of the speed of the big city and into the nice relaxing countryside. At least for a little while.

The Flower Flat is A-OK. Not the best but a nice spot for brunch. The location is tucked away on Addison and easily overlooked when walking by. The interior is flowery and a little kitschy but that adds to its homey appeal.  The staff was extremely kind and provided great service. The food was just meh. I had the breakfast sandwich, which consisted of scrambled eggs and potatoes tucked into a large roll. It was satisfying but not spectacular.  If you are looking for a low-key brunch, this is your spot!

A lovely little gem in the neighborhood. You probably pass by it many time a day and don't notice it but once you step in that door you'd never forget this place.  I usually find myself there over the weekends for some delicious waffles and French press coffee as I read. Staff is super friendly and the decor is unique and very homely.  The also have dinner on selected evening with prix fix menu and it's BYOB.  A definite stop for all the waffle lovers and those who enjoy hope in the wall family run joints.
This place is way too dang cute. French press coffee was delightful. Breakfast was good, superbly presented.

Great tea and breakfast sandwiches! The atmosphere is charming and pleasant. I always try to take people from out of town here for a brunch with a little character.  Be prepared to wait a little while for your food and for the waitstaff, but it's worth it.

Well, 5 years have passed since my first review of TFF, and this is still one of my favorite places! My family recently threw me a baby shower here and everything was just perfect. The Flower Flat catered beautiful cheeses (with local honey), mini sandwiches, and cupcakes. Everything was set up perfectly and all the guests loved the charming and quaint ambiance. Betsy was the sweetest, and my family had an easy and seamless time working with her. They made a special occasion, even more special.

I found eating here incredibly awkward.  The space is not welcoming, and neither is the service. The food was unremarkable, and I spent most of my meal exchanging confused glances with another diner.  I couldn't leave fast enough.

This place is very cute. I loved the way it felt the second I opened the door. The cozy restaurant is filled with flowers, succulents... This place feels homey and I felt like I was in an old country bed and breakfast.  The food had perfect presentation. However, the reason why 3 starts is the most I can give TFF is because the breakfast sandwich my friend and I got was lacking in flavor. I was salting my sandwich as I took bites. (I should mention, I salt my food at restaurants once or twice a year. I'm not a fan of salting my food after it's been presented to me.)  fruit was fresh, potatoes were seasoned well and done just right. Bread was tasty and fluffy. I might come back and give them another try just because of how cute this place is.

Liked this small cafe that feels like it's part of a flower store. It's cozy with a few tables of 2-4 and then a larger table of about 8-10 which can be used for informal bridal/baby showers. Some healthy options for breakfast and lunch make it a nice option with very reasonable prices.
Super cute, decent breakfast, excellent french press coffee, cream was curdled, lunch sandwiches and salads looked tasty

My husband and I love coming here for the Friday night fixed menu.  We used Betsy as our florist for our wedding in August. We gave her little direction and she over delivered. We could not have received better attention or service anywhere else. I did not have a lot of strong opinions or knowledge of flowers and when we sat down with Betsy she knew exactly how to handle everything. Our flowers looked great and everyone commented on how perfect they turned out.

Cute little cafe with great brunch menu and coffee. The hostess and chef is very friendly. We visited once and enjoyed it. I requested to host a girl friends bday and she was very accommodating. Lots of coffee beer wine and champagne later we all left happy as clams. Will go back!!

Our favorite brunch in the city! The granola is the best, we tried to replicate at home with no success! The Nutella sandwich and 3 scramble eggs breakfast is also top notch! Don't change your recipes ever!
I think I've found my go-to breakfast place in Lakeview. Cozy, friendly, and delicious... and coffee via French press is the standard.

I had my daughter's small bridal luncheon here and had been working with Betsy on the dates for weeks trying to find the best date & time. Betsy was extremely patient and accommodating in order to ensure I had everything I wanted. The Flower Flat did not disappoint. The staff were super friendly, the place is small, quaint, and adorable. The perfect setting for an intimate gathering. The food was delicious! Thank you Betsy!!!!

A total dump. Filthy, tiny, rotten AC. We were a large party that reserved the entire 8pm seating. They didn't honor our reservation time and let people from the 6pm seating remain almost three hours while half our group waited outside on the sidewalk. Small, overpriced, school cafeteria-quality courses "sourced locally" from the nearest Jewel. No sides--your side is deceptively served as your appetizer. Very slow service. (One-half of our party finished dinner before the other half had been served yet.) Sticky chairs. Tables with art-project paint stuck to them. Smelly restroom two feet from dining tables. Easily the most disgusting restaurant experience I've ever had in 13 years of living in Chicago. The owner is a flight attendant with a culinary degree. I'm thinking she's probably never around long enough to give this place the attention it desperately needs. She should probably stick to one gig. Culinary clearly isn't it. Just a gross, gross experience all around. Never again. This place is a total scam. Avoid it. Eat in your bathroom instead. That way, at least you won't have to leave your house to have dinner in a shithole. UPDATE 2/22/17: Oh, Betsy, please. You bitch at everyone who reviews your rotten restaurant (and I use that term loosely) instead of, you know, cleaning and admitting that your food comes from Jewel. I'm not mean. I'm incredibly disgusted you think your dead-grandmother's filthy basement and supermarket-container food is passable as a place anyone should ever have the amazingly unpleasant experience of eating in. A dump is a dump is a dump. Girl, you run a dump.

For the ultimately gardener or hipster/hippy.  I took my sister here for Mother's Day since she meets both criteria and she absolutely loved it. The place fits only about 10 tables total and is very San Fran. Old tv, books and furniture that would be described as "charming" if it were an Airbnb posting.  We BYOB'd some wine, got the free French press (with yelp check in, woo hoo!) and each ordered a breakfast sandwich. The which didn't taste like much without the extra hot sauce I drowned it in but it was so cute. It came with some potatoes and fruit that were both just alright. Not a foodie spot but the overall experience and good service was a plus.  The cheap prices great service, BYOB and cute vibe will snag you in and it's a nice break from the usual modern chicago scene. Check it out at least once.

Absolutely wonderful breakfast spot! The coffee was delicious and the potatoes that come with the entree were amazing. Service is slow because it's a small place but it's totally worth the wait. I recommend the breakfast sandwich but can't wait to go back and try the homemade granola!

This place was cute.  Unassuming outside, full of - mostly ladies - brunching, with mimosas.  The coffee was good.  My favorite thing is this place doesn't pretend to be anything that it is not.  It is a little dusty, but not a lot.  It is small, and there is only one chef in the kitchen, and one to two waitstaff.  This is the perfect place to catch up with a group of friends, with good food.

We tried the Friday night 3 course meal.  It's a pretty great deal for only $22 plus BYOB.  I would recommend a reservation because it got pretty busy on Friday, and the 3 courses take a long time.  We spent almost 2 hours there in total, so it's not a good choice if you're looking for a quick dinner.  We didn't really mind, though because we brought enough wine to keep us busy.  The steak and pasta salad we had was amazing, and was well worth the wait.  First and third course portions aren't huge, but you shouldn't leave hungry because of the multiple courses.

Really nice, really cozy, fun little place almost hidden away. Knowing places like this makes me feel like a true Chicagoan. It's one of those, you know it if you know it kinda places. I loved this place. Happened to spot it when I was out for a walk on a Friday night and decided to check it out with a friend today morning, and I was very pleasantly surprised. Made me feel "vacationy". Great ambience, awesome food, and the strong french coffee will make me take people who I want to impress. Apparently this place gets real crowded, but we got in early and it was fairly empty when we got there, and even with more people coming in over the time we were there, it was still quiet and comfortable. Awesome place.

My boyfriend used to live around the corner from here, so I've been here a few times for brunch and at least a handful of times for the 3 course prix fixe meal on Friday. Brunch is only on weekends and the prix fixe is only Friday nights. It seems that throughout the week, including those weekend times, there may be private events (seems like baby or bridal showers) that book the place, so you may want to call or be ready for alternate plans if you arrive and that is the case.  The place is small with between 10-15 tables in total and the decor is super cute. We've described it as a blend between a bed and breakfast and an anthropologie store. I'm not entirely clear if you can get flowers here, but there is a counter with some right when you walk in. There's a book right on the counter where you can sign up to get on the weekly email list to receive the prix fixe menu each Thursday. From that you can reply and email to get reservations for the $22 meal that is BYOB. The portions can be a bit small, but they are always seasonal and have some unique aspects and flavor combinations I probably wouldn't think of making at home. There's typically 3 entrees with at least one being vegetarian. One of my favorites was an acorn squash with cranberry, walnut, and sage stuffing served with wilted greens. I liked it so much that I emailed about getting the recipe, and she was happy to share. There seem to be some regulars who greet Betsy or the waitstaff by name. We aren't that frequent but enjoy our visits. The reason I'm not giving this 5 starts is only because of the limited hours and the wait time it can take to get food. The BYOB aspect and VHS movies (most recently, Roman Holiday) they show on TVs in each room make the time pleasantly go by though. I recommend it.

What a great,  sweet place. A former flower shop turned into a small restaurant open Friday through Sunday.  Serves a great cup of Intelligentsia french press  coffee and beautifully presented and tasty food.
I love this place! I've only been in for brunch so far. I would love to try dinner here sometime! The owner is nice and friendly and the food is great!

PROS: Exceptional customer service: I called around brunch time and the woman that picked up said she had plenty of space and told me she'd love to have us. Thanks lady! We arrived and were seated immediately-- Free coffee with Yelp check in: it's enough for 4 cups. WOOOOOOOOO. Share this with a friend, or stay up all night like me.  Price is super reasonable $8-12. They take cash or credit and will split payments. Free bacon since we had to wait for our food (we waited a normal amount of time, but hey!) Cute bathroom and interior. They had a bowl of free cat toys which was a little kooky but fitting. All bread is from a local bakery. Portions are solid. Very easy to find, right off Addison red line. CONS/POSSIBLE CONS Table was pretty sticky when we sat down-- Small--if you have a group larger than 5 don't be pissy if they can't seat you right away  There is only one chef, take this into consideration and just enjoy your damn coffee while the foods getting cooked  Oj is not fresh squeezed, I think they used Tropicana. Food  presentation could be a little better

This menu looked so amazing, and the place was so weirdly and adorably decorated (I was sat on a sofa with various marine life plushies) - I wanted to love it so bad. But it was so underwhelming. The service is crawling, and the food - while tasty - was uninspired. My friend got a waffle, which in Chicago, usually means it's at least indulgent if not inventive and super sexy to boot, but this one was literally like a waffle that I could make in a crap waffle maker at home. Just one, sad, tiny waffle, with some random sliced fruit on top. That just made me sad.

When I first walked in, I was shocked by how small it was and how I felt like I was entering someone's home. That said, the woman who took our order and made our food was impressively on top of everything! There is only one person in their little kitchen. It's intimate in that sense!  I really enjoyed the grilled cheese which I specially requested with a basil mayo they had. It was delicious and it came with a nice selection of fruit and roasted potatoes. It was only 6 dollars which was a bonus! I'll be back and happy little neighborhood restaurants like this exist!

I want to live in this space and have this breakfast everyday. Super cute and the best eggies! The atmosphere makes it even better. Literally can't say enough wonderful things about TFF. Five (million) stars.

I knew this location as a flower shop so delighted to find that it has transformed into a lovely place for breakfast. There is a sign warning you to have patience as one person makes all of the food. No problem....the omlette was seriously wonderful. The hot chocolate was as good as the best hot chocolate I have ever had. The chocolate was topped with homemade marshmallow and shavings of coconut. Yummy. I will be back. Very small with few tables which just adds to the personal feel when lucky to be eating there.

I love this place! It's always such a treat and the food is so delicious and made with such care. The place is so unique! It's short hours make it elusive but that just makes it more special. It's one of my favorite places to eat in the city and I wish I could go more often.

I met a friend here for brunch for the first time just before the holidays. I have to say, I was a little worried by the interior, which was charming in a cluttered, needs-a-good-dusting type of way. But the food was quite good and very affordable for the neighborhood. Service was very slow despite the small size. I would go back if I were in the area, but it was nothing to write home about.

"Quaint" is certainly an apt description of this place. You get the feeling you're in an eccentric older lady's house, which I happen to enjoy. The food wasn't standout but the cute lil owner was so friendly and brought out an impressive assortment of teas to try. It's a nice place to spend brunch.

This type of quaint mom-and-pop shop would normally be right up my alley, but the vintage charm of "Grandma's basement" was executed all wrong, not even good enough for Etsy. Instead of cozy, it just seemed really off. Dungeon-like, dirty, with sticky tables. The menu was uninspired. Nothing I couldn't have made at home. I realize the "home-cooked" style is for those who don't want to make it themselves, but the food should really be unique too. And the service was also unimpressive, a touch dismissive even. The singing coming from the kitchen was annoying, not quirky. Like theater kid sorority. So sad, I'd wanted to go here for years and I got this.
Really cute place with french press coffee. The owner is very nice and said hi to me when I moved in next door.

I helped plan and throw a bridal shower for one of my very best friends at this cute little cafe. It's very corky and fun inside with lots of nik nacks. It's quite small inside with two rooms and a bathroom.   We only had 10 guests and it was a squeeze.  The food was quite good and the owner even provided to go boxes for the leftovers. Overall the experience was not bad, however for what we paid, this place falls short. The place could have been cleaner and was a bit cluttered.  For over 450 dollars, a fee which included a private rental of the space from 3 to 6pm, there were multiple interruptions of our function by the owner showing the space to other possible clients. I found this to be highly unprofessional and offensive. I was already unhappy about the total cost to use the space. When the party for which we paid extra to be private was interrupted with strangers,  I was livid. Many of the other guests also found this to be a complete intrusion into our function.  I would not return to the flower flat for a future rental. And if you choose to use this  cafe for one of your functions, make sure the privacy for which you pay for is observed.

Seriously the cutest find ever in Chicago. It's one of those gems not many know about but the ones who do know are forever grateful.  Food is outstanding. And it's the perfect place for small get together parties.  The owner - she is so wonderful and sweet.  Try it out. You'll love it

I've been here many times and the food is always amazing! Never had a dish I didn't love! Ever-changing set menu that is sent to mailing list a week in advanced. Reservations fill this quaint space quickly so be sure book in advanced.

I have never left a review for anything in my life, but I could not wait to yelp about TFF. I have lived steps from the shop for ten months before I finally stopped in when family was visiting. We were blown away. The space is small and feels like you are in a fairy garden. The service was perfect- our server was quiet but very friendly and came exactly when we needed her and didn't come unnecessarily. The food- coffee was strong and perfect, we got the French press which gave the three of us about two cups each. My green tomato BLT was to die for, and deciding what to get was extremely hard- we wanted everything. However, the real show stopper was the salad. It was truly a work of art, which I never thought I would describe a salad as. All the ingredients were such high quality and arranged beautifully and went together like a dream. Oh and the lemonade! Tart and sweet and fresh squeezed. Needless to say, we talked about TFF for the rest of the weekend and I plan on going whenever I can. Thank you flower flat!

One of my favorite places in the city!  Betsy is so accommodating, sweet, and a brilliant cook!  We always have a great time, perfect BYOB place for a casual and inexpensive Friday night dinner.  I love how the menu changes and she can always fit in our regular group of 6.  Each of the menus have been surprising and delicious, we always leave full but still wanting more. We have been coming here for years and I look forward to more fun nights and delicious, ever-changing meals in the years to come!

Total hidden gem. Very affordable plus it's BYOB, doesn't get much better than that. Everything we tried tasted fresh and homemade and even the side of fruit I got was well above average and worth the $2 it ran to add it to my meal. Great coffee too! Love that they do it French press. This place is really cozy and has such a homey feel. It was a total stroke of luck that I happened upon it while walking to meet a friend for brunch elsewhere. It was a really great place to sit and linger for awhile, taking our time with that last cup of coffee so my friend and I could really catch up. The owner Betsy is a riot. She was super helpful as well as entertaining. I was there the same day as the Pride parade so Betsy kept running in and out of the restaurant so she could hand out free rainbow Popsicles to the masses! I cannot wait to go back for one of the Friday night pre-fixe dinners!

Unfortunately, I have to give 1 star only. I really wanted to like this place and I love supporting small, chef-owned restaurants.  The young kid working is not a great first impression as he was impossible to track down, could not answer either of my 2 menu questions, did not seem to know the difference between sugar and Splenda and took forever to come by my table. He only had a total of 6 guests spread out over 3 tables and he seemed unable to handle. Maybe he has never waited tables before, but at least make eye contact or look at your table as you're walking by to see if they need anything. After he dropped my food, he never came by to check on me and I had to walk over to counter to ask for check. He then refused to take my cash and insisted on bringing me check first.  However, I would be willing to forgive the service if it weren't for the food. I had a cup of coffee that was completely watered down and weak (and was delivered without sugar, cream or a spoon). I ordered the roast beef sandwich. The server had no idea if the sandwich came alone or with anything. It arrived with chips. My guess is Store bought kettle chip brand. Tasty, but I could have gone to the grocery store for a bag. The sandwich was also served with not ripe peach slices and a whole strawberry. The sandwich bread (ciabatta) was cold and chewy and the meat was the saltiest, most inedible piece of deli meat I've had in a long time. It looked like the machine pressed brands that are sold at a deep discount at a grocery store. The tomato was also not ripe and just added to the general unpleasantness of the plate.  So incredibly disappointing. I hope they figure this out bc the place is incredibly charming and has potential especially given the location.

An adorable, hidden gem. A simple and well-put together menu with delicious eats. The Flower Flat has a fun setting with lots of unique and beautiful decor and knick knacks to admire as you eat. French pressed coffee brought to the table. The owner and staff were all wonderful. Can't wait to make a trip back.

Wonderful little cute establishment. Had an amazing benedictine sandwich with chips and fruit on the side. My friends each got a waffle meal with fruit and loved the spice in the waffle. For sure a good choice for a different fun brunch spot!
Great food. Friendly place. Could use a really thorough spring cleaning. Maybe throw out the dead plants? Won't stop me from returning though.

We stopped at The Flower Flat last weekend for breakfast when we were in Lake View. TFF offers Intelligentsia Coffee which is one of my personal favorites. It was nice that they brought a pot to our table so I didn't have to ask for refills. Probably the star of our breakfast was the "Everything Nice Waffles" which I stole a bite or two off of Terri's plate. Very tasty indeed and served with a side of fresh fruit. If you want a comfortable relaxed breakfast or brunch, please give The Flower Flat Cafe a try. ;)
Feels like your in somebody's house. Everybody was nice, the food was excellent and inexpensive

When I come to town, Flower Flat is usually a required visit. The food and customer service are always top notch. The environment is probably the best thing about Flower Flat. You are constantly surrounded by flowers and you can even buy some!!
Adorable little place w yummy food and great French press coffee! Highly recommended.

I had no trouble finding Flower Flat and the food was good. I was expecting something a but more extraordinary from the reviews but it was simply really good basic fare which was exactly what I wanted. The pricing was good too :)

OMG!!! This is my Sunday brunch place! I absolutely love this place! I moved into Chicago a few months ago and checked out this place on a Sunday and I've been a regular ever since! Betsy, the owner/chef, makes the best scrambled eggs I've ever had! She somehow just gives new taste to the simplest of dishes. The breakfast sandwich is quite delicious! Great coffee, amazing decor and great food - the perfect brunch place!
Best kept secret around for small groups. Or couples. Or alone I guess. Menu changes weekly for dinner and its always good and perfect portions. The owner is super nice too.
Love this place. Really fresh tuna salad. Tasted great! The décor is very nice, kind of makes you feel like your in a garden having lunch or dinner with friends.

Spending many a Sunday brunch at the Flower Flat I can tell you it is a hidden gem in Lakeview. A quaint, cozy, BYOB weekend only restaurant, that serves the best Salmon plate this girl has ever had. Greg their only wait staff, serves it up quick and with the right amount of snark to make you feel at home. So if your looking for a great place to hang out, Flower Flat is hands down the best place to lose many an hour of your life...you'll be glad you did.

Stopped into The Flower Flat for a last minute breakfast before leaving Chicago and heading home from my vacation. I was so happy we did! This place is really small, but the food is excellent and the service was great. The scrambled eggs with veggies is delicious and the fruit was a nice touch -- not the usual melon and grape mix you get at some places. This was a great find and I would highly recommend it!

I absolutely love this place!! My two favorites: 1. I don't know how they do it.  But the scrambled eggs are the best I've ever had!! Add cheddar and tomato.  U won't be disappointed!! Always fresh seasonal fruit on the side! 2. Nutella toast! Dooooo it!!! This is the best kept secret in the neighborhood.
Closed for private party both days I came for coffee. I guess you should call ahead before going there.

Every time I walk past this place I instantly think how cute it looks. My friend and I decided to take a chance and try their lunch menu. The first thing we noticed was the warm and welcoming feel when we walked in, it was like The Secret Garden meets grandma'a kitchen. I ordered the chicken salad sandwich and my friend ordered the roast beef sandwich, they were both fantastic and reasonably priced. I can't wait for my next visit to The Flower Flat!

This place is so cute & charming! It's lovely for brunch & lunch. Very friendly, warm atmosphere. The food is all creative and wholesome. She has fresh fruit and actually whole pieces of fruit with your meal, no lame fruit cups filled with melon. The coffee is very fresh, along with all the food. I highly recommend this place. I would also consider it for small groups, like bridal showers, birthday brunches, exc. enjoy!

This is my NEW go-to breakfast spot! I live right around the corner and as soon as my boyfriend and I walked in, I was smiling! Its cute, quaint, and the decor is just darling! Cute art, chandeliers, fresh flowers! There were old Marilyn Monroe movies playing, the french press coffee was delicious, fresh orange juice, and the food was delicious. I ordered the Breakfast Sandwich and he ordered the waffles. YUM! Only reason I am taking one star off is because the food took quite a while to come out... But... I really enjoyed this Saturday morning breakfast experience!
I completely recommend this cafe, the food is delicious and the decoration of the place is amazing! We had a baby shower for a friend, and everything was great! The owner Betsy is the best!!

I almost don't want to review this place because the wait can already be annoying on a Saturday morning. But hey, it's good enough that I will overcome my innate selfishness in order to give massive public props. The French press coffee is amazing, the omelette is disturbingly delicious, and the atmosphere is downright enchanting. I was heartbroken when I moved away from the Bongo Room, but now I've discovered this place, I am content. :-)
Adorable place with friendly service, cute ambiance, and unique food menu! We enjoyed every item we ordered including the scrambled eggs stuffed in a bun like a pita pocket! Great neighborhood spot!

Great local cafè in the middle of wrigleyville! Staff is friendly and accommodating as to ordering items that aren't even on the menu. Check out these Nutella bites that my server recommended! (They aren't on the menu!)

The brunch options in East Lakeview aren't that fantastic.  You head over to Halsteds and eat food that has more salt on it than your neighbor's driveway or go over to the Wal-Mart of brunch known as Ann Sather. The Flower Flat blows the other options out of the sky.  First it is small and the wait staff is personable.  The food is enjoyable and menu is well thought out. I'm almost afraid to rave about this place because I don't want it be

I love this place. I feel so peaceful in here. What a concept. I actually go to play tennis across the street and I always stop by even Saturday at this place. We need more places like this and not chains

It was supposed to be a nice weekend. We went outside and found such an interesting place to have our brunch. The beginning was good with fresh coffee. At first , we were told that we need to wait for 20 minutes. After 20 minutes, no one came to us. But it was OK, it seemed that there was a party there and the waiter was very busy. After another 10 min, someone paid their check and the table seemed to be able for us. A waiter told us to wait 4 a while. Another 10 minutes later, we still didn't have our table. It has been 40 min compared with 20 min. No one came to us, we just waited and waited even without menu. My friend went inside and found the waiter, he asked a very simple question abt how long should we wait and ask for a menu. The host seemed not friendly, maybe she was too busy to make her money instead of answering our question. She just said she couldn't ask her customer to leave because they have paid! It's understandable, but we were very  hungry! She gave us a menu and left. And then, another waiter came to us, he   didn't tell us the time we need to wait, but blamed us not to be so hurry and other customer was important, they would not ask them to leave. But we are also customer only want to have our delicious brunch! The service is bad! The menu is also very common, the dishes on it everyone can cook at home. It's not worth waiting for such a long time. It's a waste of life! I will never go that place again!

I went with a friend for brunch this past weekend. I've been wanting to check it out since I walk by it a lot and it looks super cute.  The decor and staff make it feel like I am visiting a relative's house. It's adorable and somewhere to go to feel comfy with some good friends.  This place is VERY small though, so not good for a big group. The menu is small and the food was all ok, but I have to say there was nothing special about it. My green tea was my favorite part. Everything I ate I could have made at home and saved the money.

This place is super adorable and welcoming. It is described as a neighborhood garden cafe, and it is exactly that. Walking in, you feel like you're in the basement of your favorite aunt's house. The decor is whimsical, thrifty and gift shop-y all in one. It's the perfect Sunday brunch spot. The menu is simple but there's a lot of tempting options. My friends and I all ordered different dishes so we could try more things: breakfast sandwich, frittata, and waffles. The food was almost too pretty to eat. The fruits were fresh and the food was good. Lucky for me, this place is just a few blocks away from me. It will be my new go to spot!

This is one of my new favorite places in the neighborhood.  Hard to believe it took me this long to eat there.  The service was very nice, friendly waiter.  Coffee is in a French press, which was great.  Had the breakfast sandwich, along with the best bacon I've had in awhile and potatoes.  Thanks for a great breakfast!  I'll be back soon.
Super cool place. Quiet, quaint, fresh and scratch made.  Yum !

I can't believe it has taken me so long to write a view on the flower flat! I hosted my bridesmaids ask at the flower flat for 20 girls and the owner was amazing and by far the most gracious in accommodating my request for a 3 course tea time meal. She created the most delicious treats and her waitstaff was super friendly and really nice!!! I highly suggest to anyone wanting to throw a bridal shower, baby shower, or just to have tea with friends... This is the best place in the city. I adore The flower flat!!!

To start with something positive, the Intelligentsia coffee is strong and fresh.  That was pretty much the highlight of the meal.  After seeing it on a top brunch place on a Wrigleyville list, we were excited to give it a try with it's quaint description of a brunch spot/flower shop.  Walking in, our first impression was a dirty table that must have been the remnants of a bridal shower.  Very few flowers and a cluttered "reception desk" led the way to a cramped dining room.  With only a few tables and one server, we waited awhile to be seated, then had to ask for menus, then had to ask for silverware when our meal came.  The creamer also came with a little extra unidentified floater, so we had to wait, once again, for her to bring a clean creamer.  With only one cook, the food also took a very long time, but there's fair warning on the menu for that.  If we had waited and the food was good, I wouldn't have minded.  But it wasn't.  An Eggo frozen waffle would have tasted better than the limp disc that we were served.  The breakfast sandwich was tiny and the extra side of bacon was cold.  There's some potential here for them to up their game in the kitchen and maybe even have the server smile once in awhile...but I won't be back until they do.

You'd never know this place is here..Yet you step down and you feel like your in instantly transported to a little European cafe where nothing matches and you expect the owners to live upstairs.    It's teeny tiny and cozy. Like 4 tables.  They only serve dinner on Fridays and I believe you have to call and sign up or something.  Today we just had brunch. I'm always hesitant to order lox .. but it was SO fresh and tasty, albeit, they serve it with a flatbread that is not served warm. I was expecting a salmon flatbread  type thing..but I reread the menu and it stated just how it was served yet I had misread.  The server quickly suggested a bagel I was all set!  The flatbread was really good  but I just wanted something warm. I will say,  it did take way too long for our food.  I think they got tied up with the large party..apparently,  you can reserve a large table for special events.  This place has a lot of charm.  Nothing fancy but  I totally "get" the vibe of this place and the food while simple is actually quite good.  I can't wait to go and have dinner here!

Dining room is small but cute and the atmosphere is nice. The problem comes with the food and service; menu is very limited, each of our breakfasts were cold, and they spilled coffee all over our table. Plus, while presentation was nice, the food wasn't very balanced or delicious; the breakfast sandwich had way too much bread and hardly any eggs, for ex.

I attended a bridal shower here. The space is super cute and the staff was really sweet and accommodating! It's perfect for a girl's brunch! The place has such a "homey" feel with lots of homemade decorations.  It's like Michael's made a brunch place! We had their deviled eggs, various fresh fruit, waffles, and stratta(sp)? which is like a savory bread pudding.  Also included was unlimited OJ, floral fresh brewed iced tea, and lemonade.  Everything was delicious and we couldn't have asked for a better place to host the bridal shower.

Quaint little place - small but has a homey feeling. Definitely not full of flowers as the name might suggest. The food was so-so, like, very so-so. It wasn't horrible, but it's simple enough that I can make it myself, at a much lower cost. Definitely not the price. Service was very slow.  Overall, it seems like it's catering for people who like that kind of ambience - laidback, homey. It felt just like going to someone's home and they make a meal for you.

Wow, the food here is amazing. I went on a Friday night, which I believe is the only day they serve dinner and it is offered as a 3 course meal. They email out the fixed menu on Wednesdays and you can RSVP and make reservations. Check out their website to learn how to get on the email list. I didn't have a reservation or know any of the above information so when I showed up around 7:45 I had to wait ~25 mins. Anyway,  back to the food. For my main course I chose the pot roast and this changed my perspective on how I view the dish. I have gone all my years up to this point believing that my mom made the best post roast. TFF proved that to be wrong. It was absolutely delicious! The meat and carrots came on a bed of mashed potatoes and covered in gravy. The dish was perfectly seasoned and not overly salty. The meat was soooo tender, literally I just touched it and it fell apart. For starters I had the salmon spread which seemed to be salmon mixed with cream cheese, also very good and a perfectly sized portion. For desert I chose the cheese and grapes which were topped with a honey sauce and not overly filling after my first 2 courses. Definitely recommend trying this place. Also, it is BYOB.
Charming, intimate coffee shop with excellent breakfasts!  Home cooked meals and lots of happy smiles. I left with a full tummy and warm feeling!

I don't understand why this place gets good reviews. When here for brunch - food and service were disappointing and the space is very crammed. I left our meal still hungry and we were so awkwardly close to another table that it was a little uncomfortable. I did not enjoy our time there - the owner started talking to us when we were finished which is the only reason they get 3 stars instead of 2.

I attended/hosted a baby shower at the Flower Flat.  There were positives and negatives to our experience as a group.   The room that we rented was called "semi-private"  This room was right next to the door, and had a table where regular diners could eat right next to our table.  The space that we rented was extremely small.  We had six people, and we could barley move around.  This made it difficult during gift opening and game time.   There was no AC, and many of the girls complained about how hot it was in the space.  Not great for a pregnant woman.   I was constantly getting up to ask for water, milk for coffee and other various items. They would bring them out, but I had to get up and ask for everything.  We served our own drinks and the food was brought out on platters.  I felt like I could not really enjoy the event because I was constantly making sure all of the girls had enough water and were taken care of.  I would not mind this, but we settled at the beginning and left a full tip that servers received thinking we would get great service.  Be prepared to serve yourself.   The food was great!  I liked how the food was so innovative.  There were chicken sandwiches made with apricots that I loved.  The chocolate waffles with salted caramel sauce were a hit.    It ended up being a nice, but I really think they should do a better job of making sure people are taken care of so everyone can enjoy the event.

Meh, average food, chipped cups, too small for private conversations.  The reviews and website suggested something more grand.  Don't see a reason to come back, anyone can throw something together for half the price.  Coffee was good though.

Great little cozy place for a small shower or party of some sort. I wouldn't recommend anymore than 12 people for a gathering. The great part is you can bring your own cake and BYOB, which made for a fun bridal shower for my fiance and I!

I assume my lunch was an outlier, because everyone else in my party liked the food quite a bit. I had the portobello sandwich, and it tasted as though it contained a tablespoon of pepper, or more--it was just inedible. The tomato soup that I replaced it with was fine, but forgettable. The coffee was quite good--very rich. I drink it white, but I imagine if I hadn't diluted it with cream, it might've been too much for me. There are only six tables, so if you're more than 2 (or even if you are just 2), you might be in for a wait. The bathroom facilities are immaculate.

I have been going back and forth on whether or not I should write this review and decided to write the review because I hope that the feedback is taken as "constructive."  First, the place is quite small and as many probably have said, "quaint."   The business model is a friendly restaurant that provides fresh food and flowers, hence the name:  The Flower Flat.  We expected to be greeted with lots of beautiful flowers but instead we just noticed some flowers as we walked in ready to build a bouquet.  Wasn't really a big deal, just not what we expected.  Actually, I am not sure what we expected when I say greeted with lots of flowers, maybe just more of them around the restaurant.  We did enjoy the feel and family-friendly vibe that we got from the place, though. On to the meal.  In short, I prepare a much better breakfast with much fresher ingredients.  I can go to Whole Foods and get way better fruit, well, way better everything.  The thing that killed me the most - they charged $2.50 for some "Fackin" or Fake Bacon or that really bad bacon that you basically heat in a microwave or quickly heat up on the stove.  I HATE that stuff.  My god, pony up and buy some real, thick-cut bacon or something.  It probably would be cheaper than what is being served.   I had the eggs with fruit and some bacon, as I mentioned.  My wife got a ham and cheese sandwich, which came with some ruffles or something.  Again, they should try to make their chips or try to make more homemade things. I don't think this spot really makes much in-house.  We ordered a press coffee, which we both really enjoyed.  Forsure enjoyed the coffee. What would I change?  Well, first and foremost, the food.  They need to figure this out right away.  I would have been happier cooking for myself at home, using fresh and real ingredients.  Places like this would end up saving loads of money if they start using better food and making more things from scratch.  Get rid of that fake bacon too, it was just awful. Probably not going back unless these things change.  I would say try it out, there is plenty more on the menu that we didn't try.  It is hit or miss I guess.
Tiny place. Didn't really see as many flowers as I anticipated since they mentioned they still sell them. I had soup, fruit, and french press coffee. All really good.  Small menu selection as well.

This place is amazing. We hosted a bridal shower here and it was as if we were hosting it in someones beautiful shabby chic living room but without having to cook or clean up. The decor is beautiful, the food was delicious (we selected deviled eggs, an assortment of tea sandwiches, and fresh fruit), and it's BYOB so we were allowed to bring our own champagne bar.  We were allowed to come early and decorate, and also bring our own dessert. The prices are incredibly reasonable and Betsy was beyond accommodating. I don't know why anyone would host a private event in their house when you can have it here.

The Flower Flat was the perfect setting for a bridal shower we had a few weeks ago. Betsy made sure that everything was in order before we got there.  When walking into the establishment your first thought is wow - this could be someone's living room with a kitchen attached which is the main reason why this place is so one of a kind. The food was delish! We had the perfect amount of assorted lunch treats, my favs were the deviled eggs and chicken sandwiches. This is a perfect place for brunch with your best buds or a cozy place to sit and read a book. All round I'm a fan and think you should be as well.

Finally had a chance to stop in for  lunch today...sooo glad I  did.it  was as cute as I hoped it would be.The BFF sandwich was amazing..so was the tuna salad.(served with chips .my fav). The decor was so charming(so was the restroom). The owner and staff were very  friendly and the fresh flowers were gorgeous.The only suggestion is that they should have some soft music playing....maybe a little Enya?Can;t wait to come back for the Fri night pre-fixe dinner!!!!

We hosted a brunch at The Flower Flat to celebrate a friend's upcoming wedding and had a wonderful time.  With some dietary restrictions of our group, Betsy made a custom spread for us that was gluten and dairy free, and it was so delicious you would have never known those ingredients were left out.  On our menu was a veggie strata, fresh fruit, salad with potatoes, green beans, peppers and tomatoes, muffins with plums baked in the center, and yogurt and granola.  The strata was our favorite part, but loved it all and would highly recommend it for groups. The 7 of us had a private area of the restaurant and Betsy also setup an additional table for any gifts.  Being a flower shop, there were so many flowers around, along with many quirky items.  The décor is really neat with so many things to look at, and was perfect for our party.

I recently threw a bridal shower for my sister at The Flower Flat. Betsy the owner/chef was so helpful when I stopped by TFF to ask about private events. She showed me around, explained how she would set up the room based on my numbers and sent me several menus to look at. She was flexible when I changed the menu (a few times) and was always prompt getting back to me via email. The shower was beautiful mostly due to Betsy's amazing food and colorful flowers. I would highly recommend this location to anyone throwing a shower on a budget, since it doesn't need much decoration and especially because its BYOB! I served dinner and the highlights were shrimp burgers, rosemary potatoes/green beans, and caprese.  Thank you Betsy for helping me throw a beautiful shower!

After over a year of walking past this place on Addison, I was finally able to make it in for brunch! I tried the chicken salad sandwich and friends tried the waffles. The chicken salad had apricots, grapes, and perfectly-sized chicken bits in it with just the right amount of nuts. Not overly "saucy" with the mayo, and it was delicious herbed mayo, at that. It is obvious that it was fresh and homemade. The bread that it came on was a little much, so I took off part of it.  The waffles that my friends ordered were out of this world. They come with fresh, sliced fruit on top and you KNOW they're made fresh from homemade batter, not store-bought stuff. They were light, fluffy, and the fresh fruit mixed with the syrup really hit the spot.  We came in on a Sunday afternoon around 11:30 and were seated right away. If you come and there are no tables, there isn't much room to wait in the restaurant. It is absolutely worth coming to try, though. VERY quaint and adorable. I can't wait to come back here in the summer - it's very homey!

Flower Flat, I've finally found you. The perfect place for a Sunday afternoon with friends. Lovely service, very charming atmosphere, tasty food that can also be quite healthy, and--behold!--you can actually hold a conversation and not shout. This is a beautiful thing. My go-to spot when I want to hang out with my girls.

This is a PERFECT place for an intimate bridal shower. With 12 guests coming from all over the Midwest, we chose Chicago as a central location, and we had our doubts about booking a place without being able to visit it. But The Flower Flat had a few good reviews, so we went for it. It's absolutely adorable from the outside--a bright blue door on a brick wall, with some wicker balls strung along the top. Very Pinterest-able. When you walk in, it truly is like entering someone's home. There are knick-knacks, pillows and mismatched chairs all over the place. Still, it's not cluttered--it's a perfect mix of quirky, whimsical and cozy.  Betsy was great to work with. She whipped up a menu customized for us and basically gave us free reign of the space. We brought champagne and a few decorations to go with the wedding theme, but TFF took care of the rest! We all thought it was so charming all on its own. The food was delicious and fresh. We got caprese, egg strata, chocolate waffles, and some sandwiches with hearty chunks of beets and artichokes. The tea and coffee is brought out in your own personal French press. Plus, Betsy and "Junior," the guy serving us, were responsive to our every beck and call.  The best part? It's super affordable, and that's not just relative to Chicago. I wish I could adopt TFF and have it in my own neighborhood!  Highly recommended for a small group or just for brunch if you're lucky enough to live in Chicago.

My friends hosted a baby shower at the Flower Flat and it was the perfect location!  We were able to bring in our own decorations, but we didn't really need them. The place is adorable!  The staff was very helpful and accommodating.  Also, the prices were reasonable and the food was delicious.  I would definitely recommend this place in the future!

Put together a last minute private birthday dinner party for a Saturday night with 20 guests. Betsy let us come by early and decorate and the place is charming and intimate. We had multiple tables all near each other. A dinner menu with various options was provided and everything was delicious - especially the steak! BYOB always a plus, and it was very affordable. $18/person + $50 flat private event fee. We will definitely be back, everyone had a wonderful time. Menu:  1st anitpasto pozole 2nd (choice of...) seared steak with herb butter horseradish mashed potatoes wilted spinach pan-fried tilapia green beans, capers, lemon orecchiette, kale, white beans truffle oil 3rd coffee with ice cream and we brought our own cake

It's like walking into a friend's house for brunch.  The decor is all mis-matched in a completely charming way -and there is only the cook and the waiter for staff. The menu is tiny - but everything has been tasty the few times I've been there. I love the salmon platter -- good poritions and a good price.  Never had problems with service there -- but we have extra patience for them knowing that its such a tiny place---they are more than welcoming and it makes up for any hiccups in service we may have experienced. I can't wait to try out their Friday night pre-fix menu.
So delicious and friendly!! You feel like you're dining at home but with better food :)
Three words: cute quaint delicious from my 13 year old who came here with me and mom for Mom's Day.  Great food, portions.  Only ding is the coffee mugs. (but great coffee!)

Very cozy place for a quiet, intimate breakfast. One of the most informal, authentic dining experiences you're going to find in this city; it seems like you're at an old friend's house and she's making you lunch. Our menu today was written in marker on the back of an older menu. Most of the items were crossed off -- because they had run out -- but we were still pleased with the backup options. Good food, clean restaurant, nice staff of two and terrific atmosphere. And very reasonable prices!

This place is really bizarre. First, the good: the decor is really cute and inviting. The food was also decent, although the menu is tiny. We got the nutella toast, omelette, and salmon flatbread. Nothing blew us away but it was definitely solid food. The service was TERRIBLE. The entire place had just one waiter- it took over 20 minutes to get water, and there was never anyone to fill up cold or hot water (for tea). At one point we just gave up. Also, our waiter came by to take our order, didn't write it down, and then came back after about 10 minutes to say he forgot the order. All in all, we were there for about an hour and forty five minutes... This place is fine, but I'm not running back anytime soon.

oh this place is the cutest!!!!  the best breakfast i could ask for after a nice long run down lakeshore the scrambled eggs were delicious and the plums were just perfect! very nice owners and i'm so happy my friend and i came here on the right day (they're only opened on the weekends) so we were very lucky!! definitely wish there were more places like this one near where i live

This is my go-to restaurant for breakfast. The food is always freshly prepared and delicious. I love the french press coffee. And the place is quiet and cozy, which makes it a great spot for a nice, relaxed breakfast or brunch on the weekend. I haven't attended one of the Friday night prix fixe dinners yet, but I definitely intend to soon!

Fantastic place to throw a shower!   We hosted a baby shower and couldn't have selected a better location.  The food was amazing -- and it's byob. Betsy is wonderful and this place is a neighborhood gem!

I came in and was thrilled about the decor, and expected the food to be something original and exceptional, given the higher than normal prices. Unfortunately the tuna sandwich my girlfriend and I had seemed to come straight from a can, and the potato chips on the side didn't seem too fresh. Afterwards I got a big stomach ache, which I normally never get from anything. Not sure if it was the tuna or the chips. I'd love to come and eat there again, but the prices are too high and the food isn't what I imagined it would be. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing there, since lots of people are so thrilled about it.

So I planned a bridal shower for my bestie at the Flower Flat and boy was it wonderful. Besty the owner was so easy to work with and the food was amazing. People are still calling today asking how did I find this place! The custom made flower decorations were perfect. If you're looking to have a bridal shower this is your place! Oh and the food is to die for. Besty allowed us to mix and match from several different menus. I love this place! Two thumbs up to Besty and the Flower Flat Cafe!

We were regulars when we lived a couple blocks away from this charming little local cafe. I walked past it dozens of times before realizing what it was. Breakfast is delicious and reasonably priced. Intelligentsia French press coffee makes you want to stick around for a couple hours. Always friendly service and pleasant ambience.

This place was awesome!  It doesn't look like much, and it's not.  But the atmosphere is delightful.  Plates and coffee cups are mismatched, a wonderful variety of decor. We walked in and were told to have a seat where we liked.  As we were sitting down the owner (I assume) was mulling.  She simply said "It's not on the menu, but we can do French Toast.  I've got French Toast."  Thinking some more, stated "And I think we'll do orange.  Orange french toast." We started with coffee for 2.  French press.  I love coffee, and this was great coffee! Next, Fresh fruit and yogurt.  The fruit was very fresh and tasteful.  It had granola and honey on it as well.  Great choice. The orange french toast was simply amazing!  Dried mandarin oranges on what appeared to be home made french bread.

My friend and I went for the Friday fixed price menu and loved it!  The tilapia was moist and hot, the decor charming, and the service was friendly but not overbearing.  Best of all, we were pleasantly stuffed after an $18 three course meal.  What a bargain!   It was refreshing to go to a unique restaurant with the owner's touch instead of a chain or cookie-cutter type establishment.  I'll definitely return!

A friend invited us here for a Friday night private dinner party, and I was amazed! I had never even heard of this place, and when I walked in, I thought it was someone's house! He explained to me that the owner/chef Betsy is a flight attendant and does this on the side to fulfill her passion of cooking/baking for others. I wanna do that!! The food she made for us was fantastic. So much flavor, it was like having our own personal chef. I guess she does these Friday night dinners all the time, and you can sign up for them ahead of time. I put my name on email list (although I haven't gotten anything yet...) and she sends out the menu for that week. Then you can let her know if you want to attend.  She does brunch too, and I want to check that out just to see if the food is as good as it was at dinner.

It's a cool place for food and flowers.  Flowers are cheaper and better than jewel or whole foods. I've had breakfast here 3 times.  In the battle of sweet vs savory, sweet wins at this place.  Waffles and pancakes are fantastic. But.....I did once have the "breakfast sandwich".  Friggin weird, don't order that expecting anything familiar.  It was like a hard boiled egg and lettuce.  It was just weird, not bad, but really weird.
Love The Flower Flat. We always bring out of town guests here for a fun lunch. Can't wait to try the Friday night dinner!

The Flower Flat is one of my most favorite places in Chicago. It is very homey and welcoming and so is the owner! Also, the food is always amazing! I have been there for their weekend brunch, and for the fri night dinners and every time the food is outstanding. The owner obviously takes the time to get high quality ingredients, since they always have a different menu on fridays. Also, it's BYOB, which is always nice :)

Shabby chic is definitely how I'd describe this place, and I loved it. We booked The Flower Flat for a baby shower based on the review by Aminda S. (BTW, she is spot on with her review.) This really is a great (and affordable) venue for a small shower. We hosted the shower after business hours on a Sunday afternoon. The Flower Flat closes as 3. I will say that you should probably let Betsy (the owner) get her bearings and book the space at 3:30 or 4 instead of right at closing.  I would absolutely host another shower at TFF. But first, I need to head in there for a weekend brunch. :)

I lived only a block away for almost a year before finally trying the Flower Flat.  Based on the overall review ratings, I had high expectations going in.  Sadly to say, I left disappointed.  I ordered the Jasmine, which was smoked salmon with flatbread, cream cheese, shallots, and lettuce.  The salmon was fine, exactly what I would expect, and it was actually a good amount of it.  However, the cream cheese looked more like sour cream, which to me says that it'd been sitting at room temperature longer than I would like to be.  (I understand it may be "spreadable" cream cheese, but it was more soft than that).  The lettuce had dark spots in a few places, so it wasn't exactly fresh, and the flatbread was perhaps the most disappointing part.  It literally just said flatbread on the menu, so I was expecting like a pita-like bread.  It ended up being 2 large flatbread cracker sheets.  For $10, it was overpriced.  My boyfriend ordered an eggs dish (I forgot which one), and I had a bite of the potatoes, which were not crispy and underseasoned.  I liked the jam that accompanied his toast - it was more of a cherry flavor, something different.  Overall though, his entree was not any more impressive than mine.  The service did not meet my expectations.  When I first walked in, no one was there to greet us, and so we had no idea if we just sat down/where to sit.  I noticed a few subsequent customers also experienced the same situation.  Our server (who seemed to be the only one in the entire place) was awkward and not cheery.  Bottom line:  I was let down my today's experience, but I am willing to give it one more try - perhaps it just wasn't the best timing and I didn't choose the right dish.  At this point though, I'd much rather go to Ann Sather, which I know I'll get better food and service for the same price.
Great brunch hole in the wall. The waffle was phenomenal and worth a visit.  The French press coffee was great too. Give this place a try but be prepared to wait.

This place is always always great. So sweet and cute, and the food is actually great. It always feels like the foods are freshly made and the recipes must be well thought out. Fantastic place to grab a bite, and such a neighborhood feel.
Rude, unfriendly service. I realize they're small, but do they have to act so prissy?

I'm just in love with the flower flat. Step into what looks like a florist shop for the freshest, tastiest, and friendliest breakfast in Lakeview. The food is DELICIOUS, with portions that are just right--I highly recommend the waffle or the BFF granola.  I take all my out-of-town guests here and they can't wait to go back! They talk about it months later.. I'm thinking about going by myself right now... Oh, and it has a TV. One little lovely TV always playing a movie that tugs at the heartstrings...Whether it's Finding Nemo or an old Audrey Hepburn black & white, this background noise is perfect for the place!

I love the Flower Flat for its friendly intimate vibe, serving up breakfast and brunch with fresh local ingredients and great service! This place reminds me of the old Wild Iris in Madison, Wis., cozy and a bit granola-ey. The owner is really nice and Coffee is served up in your own personal French Press, and they are only too happy to give you a to-go cup, as well! I've been to Flower Flat a few times and you can't go wrong with anything on the menu, seriously. And their thick-cut bacon is awesome. My only ding on the Flat is that the menu can seem too small, at times if I'm craving 20 breakfast entrees to choose from- they usually only have about 5-6 breakfast items to choose. But that would never preclude me from accepting another breakfast invite to the Flower Flat!

I could not have picked a better venue for my sister's baby shower yesterday.  Betsy put together the perfect menu, and the guests were blown away by the location.  I cannot tell you how many times I was asked (between moans of delight while eating the fabulous food) how I had found such a cute and unique place.   The space was perfect for roughly 20 guests, and because TFF has such an eclectic interior, it did not require a lot by way of decorations which saved me a lot of money (hey - everyone has a budget). We brought orange juice and champagne and were able to keep them cold in the fridges in the front and wine glasses were provided by TFF. I am thrilled by how things turned out and the guest of honor, who had never been to TFF before her party, could not have been happier or felt more special. Thanks Betsy!!
Amazing food. But there is a limited selection and the portions are small. But its worth trying out because the decorum is so cool!

I walk past this place all the time and a friend and I finally checked it out. I might upgrade this to a 5 star once I have some repeat visits. The ambiance is low key, friendly, and all together inviting. Cute decor and fresh flowers really brighten the place up. The food was fresh and delicious. The tuna salad sandwich was fantastic. Not too much mayo and the cole slaw was great.  The french press Intelligentia coffee was amazing. The prices are good and the staff is super friendly. I will definitely be heading back!

I have eaten at BFF several times, and the food is always delicious; I'm especially partial to fhe chocolate stuffed rasin challah--devine!! The decore is cozy and sweet, as is the owner Betsy. With all of this "good" in the place, I decided to have a tea party there for my five year old's birthday. The par-TEA was a smashing success! Betsy made wonderful little tea sandwiches, jam and sweet cakes, pink lemonade, and, get this, PINK hot chocolate!!! My daughter was in 7th heaven, and all the little girls thought it was fabulous. Betsy even taught them how to make a bouquet that they then took home with them. Adorable! Keep up the great work BFF!!

If my girlfriend didn't live a block away (and she didn't tell me about it), I would still be walking by it and never know it was there. Hidden gem description out of the way, this place is dreamy. Brunch was really nice. Breakfast was tasty but its the atmosphere that makes this place - with all the natural light and flowers. Dinner service went above and beyond. Everyone but my girlfriend and I seemed to know Betsy (the cook/presumed owner) and now we know her too. Ideal date spot, great for groups of 4 or less.

What's not to love about this place? I have been here twice, and each time is better. The food is great cafe food, and it is a very neighborhood place. They knew me by name the second time I went, and they have great flowers.

I highly recommend the Flower Flat. You will find excellent gourmet food at a reasonable price. The prefix dinners can not be beat! I thoroughly enjoyed the cod on savory bread pudding with grape and tomato salsa The combination of flavors was delightful.  Janet

I went to this restaurant couple times few years ago; I fell in love with this restaurant, their food and their owners!  Few days ago, I finally have a chance to visit again for brunch since they only open few days a week. Food, services, and the bohemian type are still the same as my first time visit 4 years ago. I am impressed and my heart is so warm; it's like home. I smile all the time during the meal and listen the owner humming songs while cooking! How lovely and homely. :) Price-It's pretty reasonable; $6~$9 for a brunch meal! How does that sound? Food-The portion is great and healthy. It comes with fruits as your side. Food is delicious and so does their coffee. Staff- They are really friendly and don't rush you to finish up your meal. If you miss home or miss mom-style cooking, here is the place :)

adorable cafe and shop thats come a long way with a lot of love since betsy took it over.  her friendly personality and eclectic kitschy decor, added to the delicious menu, makes this a must-eat-at restaurant.  try the eggs and BFF (betsy's flower flat) potatoes.  there's something about those fluffy eggs she won't give out the secret too.  and the french press intelligensia coffee will perk you right up too!

So many passes, yet so many misses. I finally walked into the Flower Flat one day and it was exactly as I had imagined: Fresh flowers strewn everywhere and charming if not a bit quaint. A perfect spot for a leisurely lunch with mom or the girls! The coffee is Intelligentsia, served French press-style (I like). As others mention, the space isn't terribly large, so you may have to wait if you arrive during peak times (weekend brunch hours). Conversely, during weekday off-hours, don't be surprised to have the entire place to yourself (it's homey; not intimidating). I tried the chicken salad sandwich, and it didn't disappoint as it had just enough mayo. Service was impeccable and you should make it a point to check out the art-adorned walls before you leave... it's practically a mini-art gallery in here! Cool digs, good people... I'll be back.

I discovered Betsy's Flower Flat as I work out at FFC - E Lakeview, and needed a healthy, yet less-pricey alternative to Whole Foods.  From Day 1, Betsy and her staff have been beyond attentive.  First of all - I've never had a "bad" meal there.  If there's something not to your liking, she/her staff will make it right with you.  Second - remember, this is one chef, and a very small kitchen, which Betsy inherited and brought up to par when she and family purchased the place.   It's amazing what she and her husband and team have done to bring the businesses (cafe and flowers) to stunning new heights. With the increased popularity of her place, and with some neighboring dining-based businesses closing, she is becoming more popular on weekends.  Like others have mentioned in their reviews - if you walk by and there are a few tables, go on in.  If there's a long wait and your schedule doesn't permit relaxing at a meal (which I and other professionals desperately need to be doing these days), then check in later, or on another day/time. The Friday Prix Fixe meals are out-of-this world!  Get on her mailing list.  I was a frequent solo diner due to my workout schedules, but I've met some stunning neighborhood locals - either single/coupled, various ages - and we all are now TFF buddies, sharing our good times and bad in today's hectic work world. I'm not a coffee drinker, but for the many good reviews on her coffee, I would say give it a try. Her menus are self-created - done with expertise craftwomanship, and reflect her Southern heritage and love of expert cooking.   I've used her cooking services on numerous occasions to feed my ill Mom (who has severe dietary restrictions due to her diabetes and tumors) and have also contracted out to provide portions of meals for family parties.  Her Honey Mousse is to die for, amongst her other dishes.   Betsy uses high-quality ingredients, and shops for fresh, wherever it may be.  Vegetarians are welcomed here...as are meat-lovers.  Any fellow Kentucky natives out there?  Try her Henry Bain sauce...it's stunning. Her staff are loyal to her and to her customers.  Remember, weekend brunches can get jammed - and it's not uncommon for her place to go from nearly-empty, to two parties of 14.   Patience is a virtue...her food is worth waiting for. The Flat's decor is meant to be art-inspired, and she makes no bones about her decor showcasing local and other well-known famous Midwestern artists. As an Andersonville resident who has defected "South" to get good home-cookin', I heartily recommend Flower Flat.  If, (like at any other restaurant), the meal doesn't "wow" you  - give it another chance.  Like all aspects of life, we have "up" and "down" days and related experiences.

I met a friend here for brunch earlier today. She was seated in the corner and our table was round and small. It was difficult to fit everything on the table once our food arrived. My friend told me when she sat down, the server said she couldn't sit there because it was for 2 people.  She had to tell him she was meeting someone, but it was very crammed for 2 people (unless we were only having coffee or tea).  Although the decor was not my taste, it was something different than what you usually find in the city. I appreciated that the menu clearly stated there was only one chef so we should be patient. It's a really good thing when businesses are honest and upfront with its customers. I had no problem waiting a little longer for our food. It was crowded, so I took that to be a good sign.  I ordered the Benedictine Sandwich, which was tasty (although the bread was more firm than I usually like). Our server was not extremely friendly. He barely said 3 words to us. For a local business, I appreciate more of a personal touch. Overall, the experience was decent.

I was on my way to a Sunday coffee date at the nearby Senem's Cafe and Tea House when I showed up and found a note on the door announcing that they had closed early for the day (this being during the Air & Water Show). D'oh! Thankfully, I had Yelped the Flower Flat as a Plan B, so le date and I met up and headed there. I was a little surprised when we arrived and found out that Flower Flat only serves basic coffee (no lattes, cappuccinos, etc.), but Intelligentsia was their brew, and it arrived at our table in a French press, both of which my companion commented positively on. And, it was delicious. Win. Despite us low-balling the order with just drinks, our server was attentive throughout the visit, checking back twice to see how we were doing. Apparently they closed at 3:00 for the day, but we stayed from 2:45 to 4:00 and no one interrupted us or tried to boot us out. That may have literally saved the date right there. Double win. The decor was pleasantly quaint, and while the two seating areas were small, I asked to be seated in the nook off to the right where there were two empty tables, which ended up being a nicely quiet, private spot (owing more, however, to the small crowd at that hour). There was nothing that particularly blew me away here, just a pleasant cafe experience that saved me from what would have otherwise been an awkward retreat to a Caribou Coffee/Starbucks or a Broadway bar. Thanks, Flower Flat!

Shabby chic decor is not my thing.  Things seemed in need of organizing and sprucing up a little.  It was more 'shabby' and not much 'chic'. Aside from that, my omelete was tasty and the coffee was good but everything else goes downhill.  The fruit on the side consisted of a strawberry cut in half but w/the top left on, slices of pear that didn't have the core/seeds cut out.  The toast - two pieces - were both the ends of the loaf.  Not someplace I'd go again.

Had a wonderful leisurely Saturday brunch with my boyfriend and one of our friends.  It wasn't crowded, but there were other people there.  The 3 of us shared a French Press and it was the perfect amount of (excellent) coffee: about 2 cups each.  I got the yogurt and granola - I know, boring right? - but it wasn't!  It was really delicious!  The granola was excellent and the fruit was fresh and inspired: nectarines?  That's not boring!  Boyfriend got the cheese scrambled eggs and potatoes, which were delish.  Friend got a vegetarian sandwich...some kind of cream cheese with veggies, I think, and apart from being messy, she said it was good.  They forgot an English muffin I ordered, but the yogurt/granola was more than I was expecting so it was fine.  Cheerful, friendly staff. Highly recommended for uncrowded, delicious brunch.

My wife and I eat at The Flower Flat whenever we are in the Lakeview area.  It's so laid back there and it's usually easy to get a table.  I've seen a couple of bad reviews for lunch, but I've only eaten breakfast there and never have had a problem.  I was there last weekend and had the waffles, or waffle and it was wonderful.  it came with fresh fruit on top and plenty of syrup.  It really was filling.  The decor is different, but in a good way.  Funky looking art is on display and most of it is for sale, I think.  Anyway, if you are around the area and happen to be going to a Cub game or just walking around, check it out.

This is right by my house so i've been there many times. I think i've eaten everything on the menu. The french press coffee and her own special blends of tea are great on weekends when i can sit and enjoy them. They have different specials each day which is usually whatever Betsy (owner) feels like making...she's a really good chef. I have yet to try their pre fix dinners which are usually on fridays but i have heard great things. Betsy knows everyone in the neighborhood and really gives this place that comfortable feel. Oh and you can buy flowers too:) always a plus!
